message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper proposes a method based on graph convolutional neural networks (GCNNs) for localizing functional groups (FGs) in molecules that contribute to specific chemical properties of interest. This work involves the application of machine learning techniques to chemistry, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of GCNNs for modeling molecules as undirected relational graphs with atoms as nodes and bonds as edges indicates that the paper could also be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper proposes four different explainability methods that are derived from convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language).
